newsitem.title: USA: America Service Group, Wexford to merge.
newsitem.headline: America Service Group, Wexford to merge.

text.p: America Service Group Inc and Wexford Health Services, a privately held correctional health care provider based in Pittsburgh, PA, said they have signed a letter of intent to merge Wexford with units of America Service Group.
Under the terms of the deal, Wexford shareholders will receive 1,500,000 shares of ASGR common stock, representing almost 30% of the proforma ownership of the combined company.

The transaction is planned as a pooling of interest, and completion of the merger is anticipated in the first quarter of 1997. The merger is subject to the execution of a definitive agreement, ASG shareholder approval, and various regulatory approvals.
Upon completion of the merger, the combined company, which will operate under the name of Wexford Health Sources, will provide healthcare services to more than 120,000 inmates in twenty-two states.
Officers of the combined company will include:
-- James Roddey, current chief executive of Wexford, will serve as chairman of America Service Group.
-- William Eberle, current chairman of America Service Group, will serve as chairman of the executive committee.
-- Scott L. Mercy, will remain as chief executive of America Service Group.
-- Jeffrey Bairstow, newly appointed chief operating officer of America Service Group, will continue to serve in that capacity.
Corporate services will continue in both Nashville, Tennessee, and Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania.
